Request Coaching From Alex Long
Born and raised in Jacksonville, FL, Alex has been following and playing golf since he was a child. He played collegiate golf at Trinity Baptist College before transferring to the University of North Florida. After graduating with a Bachelor’s Degree in Sports Management, Alex has focused on his career in Golf and is a PGA member. He believes all individuals can improve their game when given the proper tools to succeed. Using the Fundamentals of Golf, Alex works with students to determine and communicate instruction in their own learning style.

David is a native of Jacksonville and has been a PGA Golf Professional for over 35 years. His resume includes Head Golf Professional at San Jose Country Club, Director of Golf at the First Tee of Jacksonville, and Golf Coach at Episcopal and Providence. David has been teaching and coaching players of all skill levels. His teaching method involves formulating a program for each individual or group, stressing the fundamentals and the short game to lower scores as well as learning to manage your game to play better golf.

Jacksonville BEACH
gOLF
CLUB
Owned and operated by the City of Jacksonville Beach, Jax Beach Golf Club has been a staple in the golf world of beach life. There are 50+ years of history in these greens and fairways, starting out as a private 9-hole course and evolving into 18-holes when the City of Jacksonville Beach acquired the facility. Over the years, Jax Beach Golf Club has had many transformations, but none as extensive as the latest renovation that began in January 2018.
More than a facelift, the new course was designed to delight and inspire long-time club members and newcomers alike. Golfers will enjoy a fun, playable yet interesting design by acclaimed golf course architect, Harrison Minchew. Among the improvements are lush fairways of 419 Bermuda grass and greens planted with salt-resistant Platinum Paspalum turf. The drainage and irrigation systems have been modernized and use 100% reclaimed water along with reshaped and reconfigured holes that enhance playability. Golfers will appreciate more par-4 holes and fewer water hazards. The biggest change is in the finish with the reconfigured 16th, 17th, and 18th greens.
To round out the renovation, upgrades were done in the Pro Shop and a new restaurant opened to all, Sneakers on the Green. In the Pro Shop, you will find the newest golf attire and accessories as well as equipment for your perfect game. Before, during, and after your round of golf, enjoy breakfast, lunch or a snack with a cold beverage in the restaurant or on the patio overlooking the newly expanded Driving Range. With a new look and new energy, we look forward to players “golf the beach” again!
